result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominique M Richmond in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Dominique M Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received offer and is not accepting the offer. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Dominique M Richmond in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mary Cole for Patrick Michael Brady in court for Dominique M Richmond. Called @ 3:18 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status hearing. Record by Atty. Cole as to negotiations and request fro additional status. Court sets for additional status before assigned judge - Koss.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dominique M Richmond in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty. TenHaken.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Dominique M Richmond. Called @ 2:01 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment. Record by Atty. Brady as to receipt of information and enters not guilty plea as to all charges. Matter set for status.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
3:37 PM (64-06) Defendant Dominique M Richmond in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Viven TenHaken in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Dominique M Richmond. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Adj. 3:39 PM

64-06 - Defendant Dominique M Richmond appeared in court, Attorney Patrick Michael Brady appeared in court for Dominique M Richmond, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Samuel Berg appeared in court. 
Attorney Brady requesting a new Preliminary Hearing date.
No objection from the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dominique M Richmond in court with Attorney James Duquette appeared for attorney jeramiah maynard.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance, defendant given complaint, charges/penalties explained by atty.  Preliminary hearing rights given & hearing requested with time period waived.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): CATRINA BONNER.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-270 thru 22-277

Defendant Dominique Richmond appeared in court, in custody by video with attorney Leah Selmek. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD Attorney. Minutes filed.
